questions.text: In one episode, Barry must fight a metahuman that has the power to turn people against each other by manipulating their emotions. What hero does Barry turn against?
questions.explanation:
Arrow.

	This episode was titled "Flash Vs Arrow", and was a crossover between the two TV shows. In this episode, Arrow trained Flash to use his powers more wisely and to be more observant. After he was effected, Flash used the training against Arrow to fight him. The battle ended when Dr. Wells (Thawne) and Detective Joe West appeared with a machine that produced light. Once the correct color pattern was presented, Flash was back to normal. However, it would take some time for the city to regain his trust.

questions.text: Who was the first to suspect that Dr. Wells was actually The Reverse Flash?
questions.explanation:
Joe.

	The Dr. Wells that Barry knew was really Eobard Thawne from the future. Eobard Thawne went back in time and got stuck, so he killed the real Dr. Wells to impersonate him.

questions.text: In season one, which superhero did Ronnie and Professor Stein become when they merged together?
questions.explanation:
Firestorm.

	After the particle accelerator explosion, both Ronnie and Stein were thought to be dead. Actually they went into hiding after being affected by the explosion. Firestorm had to power to produce nuclear blasts of fire. At first, Firestorm was just Professor Stein trapped in Ronnie's body. Eventually the two were able to separate and were than able to merge freely.

questions.text: In season one a character known as The Trickster, who had been in prison for twenty years, was introduced. Who was this character played by?
questions.explanation:
Mark Hamill.

	Mark Hamill, who played Luke Skywalker in "Star Wars", reprised his role as The Trickster from the original "Flash" TV show in 1990. John Wesley Shipp, who originally played The Flash, also joined the new cast. In season one he was introduced as Barry's wrongly imprisoned father, Henry Allen.

questions.text: The particle accelerator explosion caused an experimental animal to develop psychic powers. What type of animal was Grodd?
questions.explanation:
Gorilla.

	Before the explosion, Grodd was experimented on in S.T.A.R. Labs. During this time, Dr. Wells (Thawne) was a partner of General Eiling, but backed out of the agreement after discovering Eiling's methods. After this, Eiling became an enemy of S.T.A.R Labs. Grodd would later develop powers and escape to the sewers, felling Well's evil commands.

questions.text: When The Flash first appeared, Iris West began writing a blog about him. What name did she use before he was named The Flash?
questions.explanation:
Red Streak.

	For most of the season Barry kept it secret from Iris that he was The Flash to protect her. The first person to know other than those at S.T.A.R. Labs was Detective Joe. When Iris first started her blog, The Flash did not stick around after he saved people, so very few people believed in her blog. Both Joe and Barry (as himself and The Flash) attempted to persuade Iris to stop her blog in fear that metahumans would target her for information. However, she did not stop, and soon others believed in The Flash.

questions.text: In an attempt to create a safe guard, Cisco created a freeze gun that could weaken The Flash's powers if he turned bad. Which criminal stole this gun and used it as his main weapon?
questions.explanation:
Leonard Snart.

	Leonard Snart was an experienced thief that became known as Captain Cold. His partner Mick Rory, who acquired a flame thrower gun, became known as Heat Wave. Near the end of the season, The Flash and those at S.T.A.R. Labs asked Snart for help to transport metahumans to another location. Snart betrayed Barry, but allowed him to live because he saved Snart's sister.

questions.text: What city is S.T.A.R. Labs located in, where most of the events of "The Flash" occur?
questions.explanation:
Central City.

	Most of the events of "The Flash" took place in Central City. Barry at times visited Star City, where Arrow lived. In season two, Barry first met Supergirl, who lived in National City in a parallel universe.

questions.text: Barry was affected by a major event in his childhood that his father wrongly went to jail for. What was this event that Barry almost tried to prevent in the season finale?
options: A bombing at the police department
A large scale escape plan at Iron Heights
questions.explanation:
The murder of his mother.

	Barry's mother was actually killed by The Reverse Flash, his sworn enemy from the future. His dad, Henry, was sent to jail for this, and no one would believe Barry or Henry's story until Barry got his powers and The Reverse Flash was seen again. After this, Barry and Detective West did everything they could to prove that Henry was innocent. Henry was released from prison after The Reverse Flash died and a video was found where he admitted the truth.

questions.text: Throughout the entire season Barry trained to beat The Reverse Flash, but he was not the one that ultimately defeated him. Which character killed The Reverse Flash?
questions.explanation:
Eddie.

	The Reverse Flash presented his weakness when he kidnapped Eddie to keep him alive. The Reverse Flash was from the future, and Eddie turned out to be his ancestor. In the season finale, Eddie scarified his life to save his friends and erased The Reverse Flash from existence.
